member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Rmt.RmtChannelOpenStatus.ChannelUnavailable
member.summary: The channel is already in use.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Rmt.Helpers.ProntoCode.Frequency
member.summary: The frequency of the carrier wave in KiloHertz

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Rmt.Helpers.ProntoCode.CodeSequence
member.summary: The sequence of burst pairs when the code is sent once.
member.remarks: An even index is the first segment of a brst pair, and is the length of time in microseconds the IR emitter is turned on. An odd index is the length of time in microseconds the emitter is off.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Rmt.Helpers.ProntoCode.CodeSequenceBurstPairs
member.summary: The number of burst pairs in CodeSequence.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Rmt.Helpers.ProntoCode.RepeatSequence
member.summary: The sequence of burst pairs when the code is repeated.
member.remarks: An even index is the first segment of a brst pair, and is the length of time in microseconds the IR emitter is turned on. An odd index is the length of time in microseconds the emitter is off.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Rmt.Helpers.ProntoCode.RepeatSequenceBurstPairs
member.summary: The number of burst pairs in RepeatSequence.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Rmt.Helpers.ProntoCode.Type
member.summary: The type of the Pronto code. A value of 0 means the code is Learned
